text: Donald Hogan "Don" Charles (September 9, 1938 â€“ December 24, 2017) was an American photographer. He was the first African-American staff photographer hired by The New York Times. He was born in New York City.* ==Death== On December 24, 2017, Charles died in East Harlem, New York City of a currently unknown illness at the age of 79. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1938 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American photographers Category:People from New York City Category:African-American photographers
